metaData.title: Scărișoara Glacier. Bike trails Rosia Montana
metaData.description: A trail along the Arieș river and Apuseni Mountains, to one of the largest underground glacier in the world, Scărișoara. See here the trail and discover more hiking or bike trails from Rosia Montana. Book accommodation, bikes, guided tours, camping.

specificArticles.textContent: Start from Casa Petri and head towards Câmpeni, the capital of Moților Land. From here continue the road along the Arieș river, so whenever you want you can have a break and refresh with cold water from the river or to eat at a guest houses from the area. Go along the Albac village and turn right in Gârda village, on a narrow road that will take you up on the mountains to the Scărișoara Glacier. The trail is on asphalted roads and it can be made by car/moto or touring bikes. The below indications represents one way length and time.

specificArticles.title: The road to Scărișoara
specificArticles.textContent: The road takes you along some traditional villages of 'Apuseni' Mountains in 'Moților' Land. Make as many stops as you like and enjoy the area, enjoy the smell of pine trees and the cold mountain water.

specificArticles.title: The Scărișoara Glacier
specificArticles.textContent: 'This is the first cave in Romania who was declared a protected natural monument (in 1938). The cave has 700m length and the most important fact is that it hosts the largest underground block of ice (glacier) in the world.'
